intro: Veratrum maximowiczii var. hupehense, commonly known as the Hupeh arrowhead, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its tall, smooth-stemmed structure and large, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale yellow flowers in late summer, which are arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
